frame.name: Waking_up
frame.definition: A Sleeper transitions from a state of consciousness where they are largely unaware of their environment to a wakeful state. EXAMPLE: William awoke from a dream.

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: This FE identifies the Place where the event occurs.

FE.name: Sleeper
FE.definition: This FE identifies the sleeping entity.

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: This FE identifies the Time when the event occurs.

FE.name: Sleep_state
FE.definition: This describes the state out of which the Sleeper awakens.

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: The Manner in which the Sleeper awakens.

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: The state of the Sleeper upon waking up.

FE.name: New_situation
FE.definition: The New_situation is the situation the Sleeper finds him or herself in upon awaking.

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: This FE indicates an instance of the Waking_up event within an iterated series of similar events or states.

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: The reason for which the Sleeper awakes from the Sleep_state.

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.

lexUnit.name: wake.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: emerge from a state of sleep

lexUnit.name: wake up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: emerge from a state of sleep

lexUnit.name: come back around.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: return to consciousness with difficulty.
